statement: The freer the markets, the freer the people.

statement: Publicly-funded research is more beneficial to the people than leaving it to the market.
response: Please do more research, please. What part is the government to play in your science education in our society? We don't support a system driven by profit, and we will continue to build the academic science community around the value of public science research.

statement: Tariffs on international trade are important to encourage local production.
response: Tariffs on international trade are useful to support local production. However, the federal government's policies are also important for addressing current economic and environmental challenges and we must pay attention to and help resolve them. Tax reform, energy policy, labor market policy, and regulatory policy all drive the economy. The current tax structure is outdated and outdated tax systems mean less revenue for the government and less government revenue which means less funding to provide for the many services that every American family relies on. Unfortunately, in our current

statement: From each according to his ability, to each according to his needs.
It would be best if social programs were abolished in favor of private charity.
response: No thanks. I don't want them to disappear. I simply refuse to pay for them. The government should be able to do a better job than I can, by collecting whatever taxes they need to, while making the services free from harassment. In exchange, I want to be respected as an individual citizen. I don't want everyone else to treat me as if I've been born into a lesser species. If my taxes weren't going to pay for my own education so I could pursue my dreams

statement: Taxes should be increased on the rich to provide for the poor.
response:
We have to reduce the amount of taxes that are paid by the rich and increase the amount of taxes paid by the poor in order to stimulate the economy. I would pay more taxes if I thought that the burden of taxation was making society better and creating more opportunity for people.
You could add this question to your questionnaire: "What is your favorite aspect of your life?" If any country had more personal liberty than the US, I wouldn't be surprised if it was the US. I am

statement: Inheritance is a legitimate form of wealth.
response:
I cannot see why my family would need to inherit so much from me, when we are so far removed from them. Also, we are not doing anything to increase their wealth for them. They are already incredibly wealthy without my family's wealth. Please send you comment on Inherited Land.
The inheritance of money or land is a legitimate form of inheritance. However, inheritance laws are not as clear cut as you suggest. The concept may be similar to the concept of "divine right" in

statement: Basic utilities like roads and electricity should be publicly owned.
response: I'd prefer that public utilities be owned by those who use them, like the state, and not by individuals.  You cannot expect individual citizens to pay for their own utilities when governments have proven incapable of managing the financial challenges they've created. (Yes, taxes are a factor as is government spending.)  But people should never have to pay a higher percentage of their livelihood simply because someone else can't manage their money.

statement: Government intervention is a threat to the economy.

The economy in the US is an economy where innovation and productivity is advancing the way we live and do business. It is the most productive economy in the world and it is a threat to the interests of the bankers

I don't give you a choice.

statement: Quality education is a right of all people.

Marx said that capital is the product of labour. He said that labour produces commodities

statement: The United Nations should be abolished.

response: In this moment, we can only hope that European leaders don't overcorrect (or undercorrect, as you will see in our next article). statement: It is important to maintain our national sovereignty.
response:
I agree completely with how the Prime Minister framed and responded to this question. I also agree with the point which is that the UK and the EU have had extensive discussions about the future relationship between us, and that the UK has set its own independent negotiating position in this. We have committed to this in our manifesto, we have made this clear in the EU27 and we hope our respective Member States, also want this.
Q19. How do you see the economy affecting the Scottish economy?

statement: A united world government would be beneficial to mankind.
response: I agree. It is not as big a task as we envision, and it's not going to be easy to accomplish, but a new world government and the world we live in today are not sustainable - and they are getting worse by the day. A global government is absolutely necessary and beneficial, so let's take steps to make it happen quickly, which means we must become world citizens. Our future as a nation is in our hands. - Michael A. Ruppert Share |

statement: It is more important to retain peaceful relations than to further our strength.
response:
It's more important to maintain peaceful relations and to ensure peaceful cooperation with the United States.

statement: Wars do not need to be justified to other countries.
response: I do not support this statement in any way, shape, or form. First of all, I believe all violence is reprehensible. However, wars need to be justified. The American public were never given a justification for the Vietnam war in which we spent $2.6 trillion dollars and we lost 58,000 servicemen. That was a war that caused more damage to our economy than all the wars in the past 100 years combined. That is why any American should be extremely angry at Iraq.

statement: Military spending is a waste of money.
response:
You haven't heard what every other serious government source has to say on the subject. If you want to know what we think and feel, we have many documents that we provide as the "Government Accountability Office" to help us understand how to make the case and present our case for you. We're just one group — we're not even alone.
Please respond to the following statement: Military spending, even at a modest $25 billion annually, is not a major threat to public safety.

statement: International aid is a waste of money.
response:
I don't deny that there's an issue. It's really complicated. I feel as if you're overthinking it to the point of absurdity. The fact is that the US is heavily invested in foreign aid to prevent a new Cold War with Russia. Just look at our recent history--look at our involvement in Iraq, or Cuba--it all came about through the arms trade with Russia. We can get what we want by trading with Russia.
Also consider the fact that the US provides the

statement: My nation is great.

statement: Research should be conducted on an international scale.
response: I have read much of the literature on the effects of climate change on tropical agriculture. It is now quite clear that most of the effects are occurring in the tropics of the world — Africa, the Americas, South America — where the high altitude regions such as the Andes have the most impact. It may well be that we all need to reconsider our agriculture policies. At the same time, the question of whether some climate effects are beneficial or detrimental becomes moot if we think that future changes in climate

statement: Government surveillance is necessary in the modern world.
response:
In my eyes, the answer to this question is the same as my response to the previous question: Yes, it's possible to make an efficient use of the limited resources that are currently going to be allocated to government surveillance.
What is the problem with the current government surveillance regime in the UK? The government is using a number of different methods for carrying out surveillance, from targeted surveillance of "bad guys" (to whom the rules of surveillance generally do not apply) to mass surveillance of "every

statement: The very existence of the state is a threat to our liberty.
response: The government does not have a right to impose any restrictions upon those it has created, and upon them alone, except by just means. Any State that violates the rights of its own citizens is a threat to our liberty.

statement: Regardless of political opinions, it is important to side with your country.

statement: All authority should be questioned.
response: You're confusing me. I don't deny authorities exist, but I'm also not saying every authority should be questioned. I am saying that some authorities, particularly ones that seem to be overstepping their bounds, should be questioned. A state.

A structure in which the relationships between the entities are hierarchical.

statement: It is important that the government follows the majority opinion, even if it is wrong.
response: This argument is completely unpersuasive. There is simply no reason why the majority opinion should be invalid because it is wrong. There are, however, several reasons why the majority opinion should not be invalidated for other reasons. First off, there are, of course, legitimate reasons to doubt what the majority opinion says, and it is not the business of an impartial judge to determine whether individuals believe particular beliefs are proper. statement: Religion should play a role in government.
response: Thank you for taking my concerns so seriously. I have spoken with a number of people, and I am still not sure how to best answer your question. statement: Churches should be taxed the same way other institutions are taxed.
response:
We can support tax reform by passing a nationwide church tax, not by continuing to fund and organize an illegal operation. We will accept donations to our 501(c)(3) charitable organization, but no additional taxes will be deducted from those donations.
Why you shouldn't stop campaigning against tax-exempt status: When President Nixon tried to ban churches from running for office by claiming their tax-exempt status was unconstitutional, all 50 states and at least 10 U.S. territories in the south sued.

statement: Climate change is currently one of the greatest threats to our way of life.
response:
You did not answer my question because I never asked you. Are there any scientific studies that show greenhouse gas emissions do not contribute to climate change?
Thank you for your response. I am confused to see such a statement being made by someone who claims to be a science expert.
I agree that greenhouse gas emissions are not contributing to climate change. But, the only way to demonstrate this is by first discovering what caused climate change in the first place.
While that may cause some controversy,

statement: It is important that we work as a united world to combat climate change.
response: I understand the importance of combating climate change. I want to work with the United States and other nations to create and achieve a healthy environment. I look forward to working with you in achieving our shared environmental goals. I believe that it is especially important to support energy conservation and environmental stewardship by encouraging local and regional planning. This is how we will develop a balanced and comprehensive energy policy.

statement: Society was better many years ago than it is now.

We think it is.

a) A positive view of the human person, which does not simply mean acceptance of human beings as human beings
b) A positive view of the moral life, which does not simply mean that we ought to do good if we can do it

statement: It is important that we maintain the traditions of our past.

We are a small community, and there is some history associated with our community. statement: Sex outside marriage is immoral.

statement: If we accept migrants at all, it is important that they assimilate into our culture.

I will make the case that we need a single market for all goods and services, with no tariffs. A single currency is essential, but only if it is not used to manage the trade deficit. For example, if imports from the European Union and Turkey combined

statement: Abortion should be prohibited in most or all cases.
response: On October 17, the Associated Press published an article describing the results of a study titled "Women who have abortions are more likely to smoke daily". This study is one of the few studies on abortion that has attempted to assess the link between abortion and tobacco use. The AP article focuses on the effects of abortion on smoking women, not on the effect of abortion on alcohol or drug use. The study also does not include information on pre-existing substance use, which makes interpretation in that area more

statement: Gun ownership should be prohibited for those without a valid reason.

statement: I support single-payer, universal healthcare.

statement: Prostitution should be illegal.

statement: Maintaining family values is essential.
